titleStmt.title: Samuel de Lange (jnr)
born Rotterdam, Feb 22, 1840; died Stuttgart, July 7, 1911

publicationStmt.publisher: Schenker Documents Online in association with the Centre for Computing in the Humanities

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines

div.p: Dutch virtuoso organist and pianist, for a time pupil of Karl Mikuli in Lemberg (L'viv) in Galicia (Chopin pupil with whom Schenker was later to study in the same city); he taught at the Royal Conservatory in Stuttgart from the 1890s, and served as the institution's Director 1900-08.

div.head: De Lange and Schenker
div.p: There is no known correspondence between Lange and Schenker. John Petrie Dunn, advocate of Schenker's ideas working in Scotland, was a music-theory pupil of his at the Stuttgart Conservatory.
